bit.name: Always Draw Sky
bit.tooltip: always draw sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible

bit.name: Don't Strip Pathfinding
bit.tooltip: always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario

bit.name: Big Vehicle Use Center Point For Light Sampling
In Space
bit.tooltip: so we can hide hud elements like the compass

bit.name: Survival
bit.tooltip: so we can strip the elite from the global player representations

bit.name: Do Not Strip Variants
bit.tooltip: so we can test the impact of variant stripping

stringid.name: Map Name
stringid.tooltip: Used to associate external resources with this map - e.g. PDA camera setting block names.

tagRef.name: Scenario Sound Bank 2
tagRef.tooltip: Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.

tagRef.name: Scenario Sound Bank 3
tagRef.tooltip: Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.

tagRef.name: Scenario Sound Bank 4
tagRef.tooltip: Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.

stringid.name: Inside Reverb Name
stringid.tooltip: This reverb will be used for inside areas when the listener is outside.

float32.name: Local Sea Level
float32.tooltip: used to calculate aircraft altitude

point3.name: Sandbox Origin Point
point3.tooltip: forge coordinates are relative to this point

stringid.name: Default Vehicle Set
stringid.tooltip: when vehicle set is "map default," this vehicle set is used

tagblock.name: Structure BSP

enum32.name: Size Class
enum32.tooltip: Tells lightmapper desired res for structure bitmaps. Numbers in parenthesis are final sizes after compression

float32.name: Structure Vertex Sink
float32.tooltip: this is the most that we can sink a soft surface link snow in the structure_bsp via vertex painting.

bit.name: Ray Trace Adjacent BSPs On Sky Hits
Lightmaps Final Gather Ignores Backfacing Hits
Not A Normally Playable Space In An MP Map (Check This On Shared BSPs)
Dont Use Extra Lighting BSPs For Cubemaps

float32.name: Maximum Shadow Count Scale
float32.tooltip: scale up or down the max number of shadows as set in the throttle tag per bsp

float32.name: Decorator Sunlight Minimum
float32.tooltip: 0.0 means allow fully dark in the shadows, higher values will brighten up the shadowed decorators

bit.name: Enable Volumetric Light Shafts For This BSP

float32.name: Sun Direction Offset
float32.tooltip: if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground

float32.name: Sun Direction Offset
float32.tooltip: if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground

float32.name: Sun Direction Offset
float32.tooltip: if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground

float32.name: Sun Direction Offset
float32.tooltip: if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground

tagblock.comment: Describes which other bsps are physical 'clones' of this bsp This is used to determine how to attach 'position-only' elements, like decorators, to the bsps: Each clone gets a separate copy of decorators that are in both. Non-cloned bsps cannot split decorators this way - the decorator will be given to the lowest numbered bsp
relative to world unit per texel. default: 1-> 1 2-> 4 2-> 16 3-> 64 5-> 128 6-> 256 7-> 512

bit.name: Analytical Bounce Uses Per BSP Setting

float32.name: Analytical Light Bounce Modifier
float32.tooltip: When Per BSP Flag Is On

float32.name: Non Analytical Light Bounce Modifier
float32.tooltip: When Per BSP Flag Is On

flags32.name: Extra Lighting BSP Flags
flags32.tooltip: neighbor bsp that occlude or contribute light (including bounce light)

float32.name: Custom Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: 0==nogravity, 1==full, set the custom gravity scale flag to make this parameter active

float32.name: Cloud Scale
float32.tooltip: mapping to the world unit

float32.name: Cloud Speed
float32.tooltip: cloud movement speed

float32.name: Cloud Direction
float32.tooltip: cloud movement direction, 0-360 degree

tagblock.name: Cluster Potentially Visible Set Bit Vectors
Cluster Potentially Visible Sets Doors Closed
Cluster Potentially Visible Set Bit Vectors
Room Door Portal Encoded Potentially Audible Sets
Game Portal To Door Occluder Mapping

point3.name: World Bounds Minimum
point3.tooltip: Physics world will include this min point

point3.name: World Bounds Maximum
point3.tooltip: Physics world will include this max point

tagRef.name: Cinematic Soundbank
tagRef.tooltip: only for cinematics. If you try to use this for anything else without talking to me, i will stab you in the face

colorf.name: Sky Clear Color
colorf.tooltip: linear color, must check override flag above to use

tagblock.name: Scenery
tagblock.comment: This block allows you to "pose" this object's nodes. Used normally for dead bodies. The orientations block has an entry for each checked node flag, skipping unchecked ones. The blocks labeled [Readable] are modified to make reading/editing the values easier, but as a result the entry counts will be innaccurate, going too far may result in editing the wrong data. DO NOT USE THE BLOCK REALLOCATOR ON THE [READABLE] BLOCKS!

int16.name: Parent Object Name Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

float32.name: Directional Acceleration Multiplier
float32.tooltip: Multiplier applied to all phantoms' direction acceleration factors. Used to scale man-cannon strength.

int16.name: Parent Object Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

tagblock.comment: these settings vary how the sound fades as you move closer or further away from it.

float32.name: Don't Obstruct Distance
float32.tooltip: don't obstruct below this distance

float32.name: Don't Play Distance
float32.tooltip: don't play below this distance

float32.name: Attack Distance
float32.tooltip: start playing at full volume at this distance

float32.name: Minimum Distance
float32.tooltip: start attenuating at this distance

float32.name: Sustain Begin Distance
float32.tooltip: set attenuation to sustain db at this distance

float32.name: Sustain End Distance
float32.tooltip: continue attenuating to silence at this distance

float32.name: Maximum Distance
float32.tooltip: the distance beyond which this sound is no longer audible

float32.name: Sustain dB
float32.tooltip: the amount of attenuation between sustain begin and end

bit.name: Hidden
bit.tooltip: this palette is only visible in superforge, and objects within it are only editable in superforge

tagblock.name: Variants
tagblock.comment: When in non-Forge, non-essential objects need to be individually loaded. The following blocks tell the engine what to add.

int32.name: Maximum Allowed
int32.tooltip: if this is <= 0, these are 'unlimited' (up to a reasonable code-defined maximum)

int16.name: Primary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Primary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

float32.name: Primary Age Remaining
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = default, 1.0 = full

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

int16.name: Secondary Rounds Total
int16.tooltip: -1 = weapon default

float32.name: Secondary Age Remaining
float32.tooltip: 0.0 = default, 1.0 = full

int32.name: Packed Key Of Face Reference Index
Nav Mesh UID Of Face Reference Index

tagblock.name: Trigger Volumes
tagblock.comment: the name of the trigger volume specifies what kind of volume it is: 'zone_set:' 'begin_zone_set:' 'kill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'playerkill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) for player only kill volume 'safe_zone' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'location_' 'ordnance_bounds' 'unsafe_spawn' append ':*' to zone set names to allow vehicles to teleport along with their players.

int32.name: Packed Key Of Face Reference Index
Nav Mesh UID Of Face Reference Index

float32.name: z Sink
float32.tooltip: this is only valid for sector type trigger volumes

bit.name: Force Planar
bit.tooltip: force decal to be 2 triangle quad. does not clip to geometry

int32.name: Packed Key Of Face Reference Index
Nav Mesh UID Of Face Reference Index

float32.name: Initial Movement Distance
float32.tooltip: before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

int32.name: Packed Key Of Face Reference Index
Nav Mesh UID Of Face Reference Index

int16.name: Swarm Count
int16.tooltip: number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

float32.name: Initial Movement Distance
float32.tooltip: before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

enum32.name: Wave Placement Filter
enum32.tooltip: Filter which squads in Firefight waves can be spawned into this squad

tagblock.name: Designer Cells
tagblock.comment: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

int16.name: Normal Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

tagblock.name: Templated Cells
tagblock.comment: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

int16.name: Normal Difficulty Count
int16.tooltip: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

float32.name: Delay
float32.tooltip: how long the AI should pause at this point

float32.name: Angle
float32.tooltip: the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

int16.name: Scenario Ordnance Bounds Trigger Volume Index

tagRef.name: Inside Cluster Sound
tagRef.tooltip: play only when player is inside cluster.

int16.name: Parent Object Index
int16.tooltip: if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

tagblock.name: Designer Zonesets
tagblock.comment: This block is essentially leftover import data and is only useful as a reference to where something is loaded. Modifying anything in this block won't change anything.

float32.name: Time
float32.tooltip: if you finish in under this time you get the following bonus

float32.name: Class Biped
float32.tooltip: max - .2f

float32.name: Class Dead Biped
float32.tooltip: max - .09f

float32.name: Class Crates + Vehicles
float32.tooltip: max - .2f

float32.name: Class Debris
float32.tooltip: max - .04f

tagblock.name: Garbage Collection
tagblock.tooltip: specify zero for values that should use the data in the globals tag.
tagblock.comment: time before the game considers that following entities as garbage

int32.name: Maximum Dead Body Count
int32.tooltip: above this number, overloaded mp time is used to garbage collect dead bodies
